G.L. c. 218, \u00a7 19.proposition: Jurisdiction and venue are proper in the Brockton District Court pursuant to Massachusetts General Laws, including G.L. c. 218, § 19 (district court civil jurisdiction in tort/contract up to statutory limits), and because the Premises and the events giving rise to this action are located in Brockton, Bristol County, Massachusetts.

105 CMR 410.000 (State Sanitary Code, Mi.raw_text: 105 CMR 410.000 (State Sanitary Code, Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation)
105 CMR 410.000 (State Sanitary Code, Mi.proposition: Under Massachusetts law, every residential lease carries an implied covenant of quiet enjoyment and habitability, which includes the tenant's right to essential services necessary for occupancy, including adequate heat and hot water. See, e.g., 105 CMR 410.000 (State Sanitary Code, Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation); see also M.G.L. c. 111, § 127L (authorizing local boards of health to enforce sanitary code standards); M.G.L. c. 186 (Landlord and Tenant statutes).

M.G.L. c. 186 (Landlord and Tenant statu.proposition: Under Massachusetts law, every residential lease carries an implied covenant of quiet enjoyment and habitability, which includes the tenant's right to essential services necessary for occupancy, including adequate heat and hot water. See, e.g., 105 CMR 410.000 (State Sanitary Code, Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation); see also M.G.L. c. 111, § 127L (authorizing local boards of health to enforce sanitary code standards); M.G.L. c. 186 (Landlord and Tenant statutes).

105 CMR 410.000 et seq..proposition: The State Sanitary Code and other Massachusetts housing laws require a landlord to provide safe and sanitary housing, including adequate hot water and plumbing facilities. See 105 CMR 410.000 et seq.; M.G.L. c. 111; M.G.L. c. 186 (general landlord duties).

M.G.L. c. 111.proposition: The State Sanitary Code and other Massachusetts housing laws require a landlord to provide safe and sanitary housing, including adequate hot water and plumbing facilities. See 105 CMR 410.000 et seq.; M.G.L. c. 111; M.G.L. c. 186 (general landlord duties).
